title: React Single Page Application POC
description: Generates a complete proof of concept for a React SPA with routing, state management, and API integration.
template:
Create a proof of concept React Single Page Application for {{project_name}}.

**Requirements:**
- Purpose: {{purpose}}
- Key features: {{features}}
- Target users: {{target_users}}

**Technical Stack:**
- React 18+ with TypeScript
- React Router for navigation
- {{state_management}} for state (Redux Toolkit, Zustand, or Context API)
- {{styling}} for styling (Tailwind CSS, Material-UI, or CSS Modules)
- Axios for API calls
- Vite for build tooling

**Generate:**
1. Project structure with organized folders (components, pages, hooks, services, utils)
2. Main application shell with routing
3. 3-5 example pages based on {{features}}
4. Reusable component library (Button, Card, Form, Modal)
5. API service layer with mock data
6. State management setup
7. Responsive layout with navigation
8. README with setup instructions
9. Basic unit tests with Vitest
10. Environment configuration (.env.example)

**Deliverables:**
- Complete runnable codebase
- Package.json with all dependencies
- Development and production build scripts
- Basic documentation

API Backend: {{api_backend}}

Output: Complete React POC codebase | File structure | Setup guide | Next steps recommendations

purpose.description: Business purpose (e.g., 'Customer dashboard for viewing orders')

features.description: Comma-separated key features (e.g., 'user login, product catalog, shopping cart')

input.features: inventory list, stock alerts, add/edit items

examples.output_outline: Complete React app with: InventoryList page with table, StockAlerts with notifications, ItemForm for CRUD, Zustand store for inventory state, Tailwind-styled components, mock REST API with JSON data, responsive sidebar navigation, setup instructions, ready to run with npm run dev

title: Node.js REST API POC
description: Generates a production-ready Node.js REST API proof of concept with Express, authentication, and database integration.
template:
Create a proof of concept Node.js REST API for {{project_name}}.

**Requirements:**
- Purpose: {{purpose}}
- Resources to expose: {{resources}}
- Authentication: {{auth_method}}
- Database: {{database}}

**Technical Stack:**
- Node.js 18+ with TypeScript
- Express.js framework
- {{database}} database with Prisma/TypeORM
- JWT authentication (if required)
- Express Validator for input validation
- Winston for logging
- Jest for testing

**Generate:**
1. Project structure (controllers, services, models, middleware, routes)
2. RESTful endpoints for {{resources}}:
   - GET /resource (list with pagination)
   - GET /resource/:id (single item)
   - POST /resource (create)
   - PUT /resource/:id (update)
   - DELETE /resource/:id (delete)
3. Authentication middleware (if needed)
4. Request validation
5. Error handling middleware
6. Database models and migrations
7. Environment configuration
8. API documentation (Swagger/OpenAPI)
9. Unit and integration tests
10. Docker setup

**Deliverables:**
- Complete API codebase
- OpenAPI specification
- Postman collection
- README with setup and API docs
- Docker Compose for development

Output: Complete Node.js API POC | OpenAPI spec | Setup guide | Test examples

examples.output_outline: Express API with: 4 resource endpoints with full CRUD, JWT auth with login/register, PostgreSQL with Prisma, input validation, error handling, Swagger UI at /api-docs, 15 unit tests, Dockerfile, docker-compose with db, README with curl examples, ready to run with npm start

title: Python FastAPI Microservice POC
description: Creates a modern Python microservice POC using FastAPI with async support, validation, and documentation.
template:
Create a proof of concept Python FastAPI microservice for {{project_name}}.

**Requirements:**
- Purpose: {{purpose}}
- Endpoints: {{endpoints}}
- Data processing: {{data_processing}}
- Database: {{database}}

**Technical Stack:**
- Python 3.11+ with type hints
- FastAPI framework
- Pydantic for validation
- SQLAlchemy/Tortoise ORM
- Alembic for migrations
- pytest for testing
- uvicorn server

**Generate:**
1. Project structure (routers, models, schemas, services, dependencies)
2. API endpoints for {{endpoints}}
3. Request/response models with Pydantic
4. Async database operations
5. Dependency injection
6. CORS middleware
7. Health check endpoint
8. Auto-generated OpenAPI docs
9. Environment configuration with pydantic-settings
10. Unit tests with pytest
11. Docker setup

**Features:**
- Automatic API documentation (Swagger UI, ReDoc)
- Type checking with mypy
- Code formatting with black/ruff
- Async/await throughout
- Error handling with custom exceptions

**Deliverables:**
- Complete FastAPI codebase
- requirements.txt and pyproject.toml
- Dockerfile and docker-compose
- README with examples
- Test suite

Output: Complete FastAPI POC | API documentation | Setup guide | Test coverage report

examples.output_outline: FastAPI service with: 4 async endpoints, file upload handling, background task queue for processing, PostgreSQL with SQLAlchemy, Pydantic models for validation, Swagger at /docs, pytest fixtures, Docker with worker process, README with curl examples, 90% test coverage

title: Next.js Full-Stack Application POC
description: Generates a full-stack Next.js application with API routes, database integration, and authentication.
template:
Create a proof of concept full-stack application using Next.js for {{project_name}}.

**Requirements:**
- Purpose: {{purpose}}
- Features: {{features}}
- Authentication: {{auth_required}}
- Database: {{database}}

**Technical Stack:**
- Next.js 14+ with App Router
- TypeScript
- React Server Components
- API Routes
- {{database}} with Prisma
- {{auth_provider}} for authentication
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Server Actions

**Generate:**
1. Next.js app structure (app directory, components, lib)
2. Pages for {{features}}
3. API routes for backend logic
4. Database schema and Prisma client
5. Authentication setup (if required)
6. Server and client components
7. Form handling with Server Actions
8. Loading and error states
9. Responsive UI with Tailwind
10. Environment configuration
11. Testing setup

**Features:**
- Server-side rendering (SSR)
- Static site generation (SSG) where applicable
- API routes for backend
- Optimized images and fonts
- SEO-friendly

**Deliverables:**
- Complete Next.js application
- Database schema and migrations
- README with setup instructions
- Vercel deployment config

Output: Complete Next.js POC | Database schema | Deployment guide | Feature documentation

input.features: user profiles, create posts, comments, search

examples.output_outline: Next.js app with: App router structure, 5 pages (home, profile, new post, post detail, search), API routes for CRUD, Prisma schema for User/Post/Comment, NextAuth with GitHub/Google, RSC for performance, Tailwind UI, Server Actions for mutations, ready to deploy on Vercel

title: Spring Boot REST API POC
description: Creates an enterprise-grade Spring Boot REST API proof of concept with security, validation, and persistence.
template:
Create a proof of concept Spring Boot REST API for {{project_name}}.

**Requirements:**
- Purpose: {{purpose}}
- Domain entities: {{entities}}
- Security: {{security_type}}
- Database: {{database}}

**Technical Stack:**
- Spring Boot 3.2+
- Spring Web (REST)
- Spring Data JPA
- Spring Security
- {{database}} database
- Maven/Gradle build
- Lombok for boilerplate reduction
- MapStruct for DTO mapping
- Springdoc OpenAPI for docs

**Generate:**
1. Spring Boot project structure (controller, service, repository, model, dto)
2. RESTful endpoints for {{entities}}
3. JPA entities and relationships
4. Repository interfaces with custom queries
5. Service layer with business logic
6. DTO classes with validation
7. Global exception handling
8. Security configuration
9. Database configuration with Flyway/Liquibase
10. OpenAPI documentation
11. Integration tests
12. Application properties

**Features:**
- Pagination and sorting
- HATEOAS links (optional)
- Input validation
- Actuator endpoints
- Profile-based configuration

**Deliverables:**
- Complete Spring Boot application
- Database migration scripts
- README with API documentation
- Postman collection
- Docker configuration

Output: Complete Spring Boot POC | OpenAPI spec | Setup guide | Test examples

examples.output_outline: Spring Boot API with: 4 REST controllers with CRUD, JPA entities with relationships, pagination support, JWT security with role-based access, Flyway migrations, Springdoc at /swagger-ui, 20 integration tests, Docker Compose with PostgreSQL, application-dev.properties, ready to run with ./mvnw spring-boot:run

title: Vue.js Single Page Application POC
description: Creates a modern Vue.js 3 SPA with Composition API, Pinia state management, and TypeScript.
template:
Create a proof of concept Vue.js Single Page Application for {{project_name}}.

**Requirements:**
- Purpose: {{purpose}}
- Key features: {{features}}
- UI framework: {{ui_framework}}

**Technical Stack:**
- Vue 3 with Composition API
- TypeScript
- Vite for build tooling
- Vue Router
- Pinia for state management
- {{ui_framework}} for UI components
- Axios for HTTP
- Vitest for testing

**Generate:**
1. Vue project structure (views, components, composables, stores)
2. Main pages for {{features}}
3. Reusable component library
4. Pinia stores with actions and getters
5. Vue Router with navigation guards
6. Composables for shared logic
7. API service layer
8. Form validation
9. Responsive layout
10. Unit tests
11. Environment configuration

**Features:**
- Composition API with `<script setup>`
- TypeScript throughout
- Reactive state management
- Route-based code splitting
- Optimized builds

**Deliverables:**
- Complete Vue.js codebase
- Component documentation
- README with setup
- Dev and prod configurations

Output: Complete Vue POC | Component library | Setup guide | Best practices

input.features: project list, task board, time tracking, reports

examples.output_outline: Vue 3 app with: Composition API, 4 main views, Pinia stores for projects/tasks, Vue Router with auth guards, Element Plus components, composables for API calls, drag-drop task board, chart.js for reports, TypeScript interfaces, Vitest tests, ready with npm run dev

title: GraphQL API POC with Apollo Server
description: Generates a GraphQL API proof of concept with Apollo Server, type-safe resolvers, and database integration.
template:
Create a proof of concept GraphQL API for {{project_name}}.

**Requirements:**
- Purpose: {{purpose}}
- Types to expose: {{types}}
- Database: {{database}}
- Authentication: {{auth_required}}

**Technical Stack:**
- Node.js with TypeScript
- Apollo Server 4
- GraphQL Code Generator
- {{database}} with Prisma/TypeORM
- DataLoader for batching
- GraphQL Shield for authorization

**Generate:**
1. GraphQL schema (schema.graphql)
2. Type definitions for {{types}}
3. Query resolvers (list, single, filtered)
4. Mutation resolvers (create, update, delete)
5. Subscription resolvers (if needed)
6. Database models and relations
7. Context setup with auth
8. DataLoader for N+1 prevention
9. Custom scalars (Date, JSON, etc.)
10. Error handling
11. GraphQL Playground/Apollo Studio
12. Unit tests for resolvers

**Features:**
- Type-safe resolvers with codegen
- Pagination (cursor-based)
- Filtering and sorting
- Field-level authorization
- Query complexity analysis
- Performance monitoring

**Deliverables:**
- Complete GraphQL API
- Schema documentation
- Example queries and mutations
- README with usage
- Docker setup

Output: Complete GraphQL POC | Schema docs | Query examples | Performance guide

examples.output_outline: Apollo Server with: GraphQL schema for 4 types, queries with filtering/pagination, mutations with validation, Prisma with PostgreSQL, JWT auth in context, DataLoader for user/post batching, GraphQL Playground, 15 resolver tests, subscription for new posts, Docker Compose, README with curl examples

title: React Native Mobile App POC
description: Creates a cross-platform mobile app proof of concept using React Native with navigation and API integration.
template:
Create a proof of concept React Native mobile application for {{project_name}}.

**Requirements:**
- Purpose: {{purpose}}
- Key screens: {{screens}}
- Platform: {{platform}}
- API backend: {{api_type}}

**Technical Stack:**
- React Native with TypeScript
- React Navigation
- Redux Toolkit or Zustand
- React Query for data fetching
- {{ui_library}} for UI components
- AsyncStorage for persistence
- Expo (optional)

**Generate:**
1. Project structure (screens, components, navigation, services)
2. Navigation setup (Stack, Tab, Drawer)
3. Screens for {{screens}}
4. Reusable UI components
5. API service layer
6. State management setup
7. Authentication flow
8. Local data persistence
9. Platform-specific code (if needed)
10. Push notification setup
11. App icons and splash screen

**Features:**
- Cross-platform (iOS/Android)
- Native navigation
- Offline support
- Form handling
- Image upload
- Responsive design

**Deliverables:**
- Complete React Native app
- Build configurations
- README with setup
- Screenshots
- App Store submission checklist

Output: Complete React Native POC | Navigation flow | Build guide | Platform notes

examples.output_outline: React Native app with: 5 screens, Tab + Stack navigation, Zustand for state, React Query for API, AsyncStorage for workouts, Material Design with Paper, chart.js for progress, camera for photos, push notifications, works on iOS/Android, build configs for both platforms, README with Xcode/Android Studio setup

title: Angular Single Page Application POC
description: Creates an enterprise-grade Angular SPA with reactive forms, routing, state management, and HTTP services.
template:
Create a proof of concept Angular Single Page Application for {{project_name}}.

**Requirements:**
- Purpose: {{purpose}}
- Key features: {{features}}
- Angular version: {{angular_version}}
- State management: {{state_management}}

**Technical Stack:**
- Angular 17+ with TypeScript
- Standalone components (or NgModules)
- Angular Router with guards
- RxJS for reactive programming
- {{state_management}} for state (NgRx, Akita, or Services)
- {{ui_framework}} for UI components
- HttpClient with interceptors
- Angular CLI for tooling

**Generate:**
1. Angular project structure:
   - Core module (services, guards, interceptors)
   - Shared module (components, directives, pipes)
   - Feature modules for {{features}}
   - Models and interfaces
2. Routing configuration:
   - Route definitions with lazy loading
   - Route guards (auth, can-deactivate)
   - Resolver services
3. Components for {{features}}:
   - Smart (container) components
   - Dumb (presentational) components
   - Reactive forms with validation
4. Services:
   - HTTP API services
   - Authentication service
   - State management services
5. State management setup:
   - NgRx store/effects/selectors (if NgRx)
   - Service-based state (if simpler)
6. Interceptors:
   - Auth token interceptor
   - Error handling interceptor
   - Loading interceptor
7. Pipes and directives
8. Unit tests (Jasmine/Jest)
9. E2E tests (Cypress/Playwright)
10. Environment configuration

**Angular Features:**
- Signals (Angular 16+)
- Standalone components
- Dependency injection
- OnPush change detection
- Lazy loading
- AOT compilation

**Deliverables:**
- Complete Angular application
- Component library
- README with setup
- Testing configuration
- Build optimization config

Output: Complete Angular POC | Component Structure | Setup Guide | Best Practices

examples.output_outline: Angular 17 app with: Standalone components, 4 feature modules (lazy loaded), Angular Material UI, Signals for state, reactive forms, HTTP interceptors for auth/errors, route guards, chart.js integration for dashboard, data table with sorting/filtering, 25 unit tests with Jest, Cypress E2E tests, production build optimizations, README with ng serve instructions
